div1.p: Sacasa informs Hench that Mrs. Dodge is a sister of James Carroll's wife.

div1.head: Letter from Carlos F. Sacasa to Philip Showalter Hench, December 17, 1941

GEORGE DOCK, M. D., PRES.
JAMES ROBERT SANFORD, M. D.
VICE-PRESIDENT
STEPHEN SMITH, M. D., F.A.C.P.
CHAS. W. THOMPSON, M. D., F.A.C.P.
LAS ENCINAS SANITARIUM
PASADENA, CALIFORNIA
Dec 17 - 1941
My dear Dr Hench:
div1.p:
It was very nice to have had the
opportunity of seing both Mrs Hench and you on my
recent trip to Rochester and I want to thank you
again for your many kindness to me.

I had an uneventful trip back
but found California in the midst of war, blackouts,
etc. However life seems to be setting down again
to more peaceful ways.

In regards to the Carroll affair,
our Mrs Dodge was a sister of Dr Carroll's wife,
so the man in Washington is her nephew. If
I can be of any help to you in this matter I shall
be very glad.

Mother and Gloria are returning tomorrow
from Central America, so with the exception of my brother
we shall be all together for Christmas.

My best wishes for a Merry Christmas
and a Happy New Year
